newsitem.title: switzerland: SKI JUMPING-PETERKA JUMPS TO FOURTH WORLD CUP WIN.
newsitem.headline: SKI JUMPING-PETERKA JUMPS TO FOURTH WORLD CUP WIN.

text.p: Seventeen-year-old Primoz Peterka of Slovenia followed up his Fours Hills victory with his fourth World Cup ski jumping win of the season on Saturday.
Peterka, lying third after the first round, unleashed the day's top jump of 130.60 metres on his second attempt, finishing with a two-jump combined score of 252.50 points.

German Dieter Thoma, who has been battling with Peterka for the lead in the overall standings all season, produced another consistent effort with jumps of 125.00 and 122.30 metres but continued to lose ground to the young Slovenian, settling for second place with a score of 247.30.
Poland's Adam Malysz, the leader after the first round with a jump of 126.90 metres, could do no better than 114.50 on his second and dropped to third with 241.40.
Jani Soininen of Finland was fourth with 233.10.
The victory allowed Peterka to strengthen his lead at the top of the overall standings with 732 points.
He is pursued by Thoma with 620 and Austria's Andreas Goldberger in third with 543.
